CHAPTER XIII.

THE FIRST COLONY OF ST. JERONYMQ FOUNDED FOR THE ABIPONES RIIKAHES.

CORDOBA, impatient of war, and now no longer able to contend with her calarnities, was eager to behold the Abipones appeased and recon- ciled. The instrument of attaining this de- sirable object was Father Diego Horbegozo, a Biscayan. He strongly urged the Abipones who frequented Sta. Fe, and the Vice-Go- vernor Francisco de Vera Muxica, the lat- ter to build, and the former to accept of a colony3 and his wishes were gratified in both points. to this condition, because he flattered himself
